definition: eloquent and fluent speaker (idiom); grandiloquence/the gift of the gab

sentences.english: After all, slang is, by definition, more clever than standard English.
sentences.chinese: 就其特征而言，毕竟俚语比标准英语更伶俐。

sentences.english: She is a cultured and bright girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个温文尔雅，聪明伶俐的女孩。

sentences.english: The best horse needs breeding, and the aptest child needs teaching.
sentences.chinese: 最好的马要驯，最伶俐的孩子要教。

sentences.english: Li Hong is an intelligent pupil.
sentences.chinese: 李红是个伶俐的小学生。

sentences.english: It is easy to teach smart students.
sentences.chinese: 教聪明伶俐的学生很轻松。

sentences.english: You being so clever and all.
sentences.chinese: 你一向都这么聪明伶俐。

sentences.english: It is believed that girls are usually more articulate than boys.
sentences.chinese: 通常来讲，女孩子比男孩子口齿更伶俐。

sentences.english: She is very smart, even if you accept that I am such a doting grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 的确，我相当宠爱这个孩子，但她也确实非常伶俐。

sentences.english: The bellhops moved silently and instantly and efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 宾馆侍者安静伶俐高效地来回忙碌着。

sentences.english: I am sure Tom can persuade her. He has kissed the Blarney stone.
sentences.chinese: 荡姆口齿伶俐，相信一定可以说服她的。

sentences.english: A good tongue is a good weapon.
sentences.chinese: 伶俐的口齿是一种锐利的武器。

sentences.english: I recognize that he is cleverer than I am.
sentences.chinese: 他的聪明伶俐超过我所料想的。

sentences.english: Thee best horse needs breeding, and the aptest child needs teaching.
sentences.chinese: 最好的马要驯，最伶俐的孩子要教。

sentences.english: An articulate, educated man, M is still quitestrong.
sentences.chinese: M是位口齿伶俐，受过教育的人，也非常强壮。

sentences.english: Zhuang Lingli in water is the most popular wealth to the fun things like folk.
sentences.chinese: 伶俐水是壮族年俗中最富于情趣的民俗事象。

definition: eloquent and fluent speaker (idiom); grandiloquence/the gift of the gab
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
